definitions.definition: A person who loses ; one who fails to win or thrive .
examples: In a two-horse race there is always one winner and one loser .
He was always a good loser .

definitions.definition: A person who is frequently unsuccessful in life.
examples: That guy is a born loser !
I'm a constant loser in love.

definitions.definition: One who or that which loses something, such as extra weight, car keys, etc.
A losing proposition , one that is likely to lose or already has lost (such as a losing bet or, analogously, a predictably fruitless task or errand).
A person convicted of a crime , especially more than once.
examples: He's a three-time loser doing twenty years.

main_definition: A person who loses ; one who fails to win or thrive .
secondary_definitions: A person who is frequently unsuccessful in life.
( derogatory ) A contemptible or unfashionable person.
One who or that which loses something, such as extra weight, car keys, etc.
A losing proposition , one that is likely to lose or already has lost (such as a losing bet or, analogously, a predictably fruitless task or errand).
( slang ) A person convicted of a crime , especially more than once.
